name: Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Approval of subsoil drainpipe and filter sock
Acceptance Criteria - Subsoils to be 110mm OD twin wall perforated HDPE subsoil pipe (smooth inner wall and corrugated outer wall) that complies with the requirements of Clause 3.1.8 NZTA F/2:2013
Verifying Document - Confirmation from Stantec representative
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Approval of geotextile cloth
Acceptance Criteria - Geotextile complying with the requirements of NZTA F/7, Strength Class B, Filtration Class 1
Verifying Document - Confirmation from Stantec representative
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Subsoil drain trench dimensions are to be checked against specifications
Acceptance Criteria - Trench has been excavated to the following dimensions:
— Trench depth to ensure 600mm minimum below subgrade level, or 1200mm below finished level whichever is greater
Verifying Document - Visual inspection, site photos
4.2 - Subsoil Drain Installation - bedding and geotextile material
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Inspection of bedding drainage chip and geotextile placement

Acceptance Criteria - Placement of bedding layer, and geotextile cloth must meet specifications outlined in Clause 16.3.27 of the Project Specification and be cosistent with the methodology statement. Minimum 75mm drainage chip bedding. Geotextile to be wrapped around 40/20 drainage chip.
Verifying Document - Visual inspection, site photos
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Inspection of installed subsoil drain pipe
Acceptance Criteria - Pipe is to be free of punctures and dents. Subsoil drain to have a minimum grade of 0.5%.
Verifying Document - Visual inspection, site photos, as-built records
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Check backfill of drainage chip and wrap of geotextile
Acceptance Criteria - Minimum 300mm drainage chip above subsoild drain, thin layer of drainage chip used to hold the geotextile in place.
Verifying Document - Visual inspection, site photos
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Inspect thickness of lifts and compaction is sufficient
Acceptance Criteria - Backfill with material as specified by the engineer. Backfill in 200-250mm lifts and compact.
Verifying Document - Visual inspection, site photos
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Inspection of flushing point

Acceptance Criteria - Flushing points shall be provided on subsoil drains and shall generally be at 50m centres and every high point. Flushing points include PVC-U pipes and fittings, which shall comply with TNZ specifications outlined in Clause 16.1.1 Project Specification. Access to flushing points shall be via a cast iron valve box with a cover marked “RE” (rodding eye). The valve box and cover shall comply with PCC specifications and be placed behind the protection of the guardrail and out of the traffic live lane.
Verifying Document - Visual inspection, site photos, as-built records
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Surveyor supply as-built of completed section once backfilling has been completed
Acceptance Criteria - As-built survey of subsoil line and associated flushing points
Verifying Document - Site photos, survey as-builts
